data.title: Blades get swept by arch-rival P.A Raiders in weekend home-and-home series
data.description: The Blades fall to 9-4-1-0 this season in the Western Hockey League with the pair of losses.

data.title: Moe slams Trudeau's 'outright attack' on Sask. energy sector
data.description: 'We understand there’s a transition, but there’s also going to be usage of (oil) products today, and in purchasing those products we ask the world and the prime minister to advocate for Saskatchewan products, which today are some of the most sustainable,' Moe said.

data.title: Huskies round-up: Women's basketball squad rings in home schedule with sweep
data.description: With a weekend sweep, the reigning U Sport champion Huskies improved their record to 4-0 in Canada West play this season.

data.title: COVID-19: Seniors lose 'second home' as day programs stay shuttered
data.description: Day programs for older adults are sources of socialization, health services and connection, but they've been closed for nearly 20 months.

data.title: Saskatoon food bank sees influx of clients after changes to social assistance
data.description: SIS allots $575 per month for shelter in Regina and Saskatoon and $285 for a basic allowance, meant to include food, clothing and utilities.

data.title: Young Innovators: Coffee ground waste may be a lucrative tool to reduce carbon emissions
data.description: A University of Saskatchewan research team has been investigating how to transform used coffee grounds into a new carbon storage product.

data.title: Football Huskies eye playoff date with UBC after regular season wraps up with a win
data.description: "When we win the line of scrimmage, it just makes life so much easier."

data.title: New Indigenous relations minister to look into appeal dropped over Catholic Church's residential school payments
data.description: Marc Miller said he hasn't seen the final agreement releasing the Catholic bodies from their obligations, but wants to have a look. 'I absolutely do want to see it. I want to get to the bottom of it,' he said.

data.title: Quotes from the fourth wave of the COVID-19 pandemic in Saskatchewan
data.description: Here are some of the most memorable quotes as the fourth wave of the pandemic created a crisis in Saskatchewan.

data.title: Saskatchewan's two largest airports starting to see runway to recovery
data.description: Regina, Saskatoon airports' CEOs welcome international flights' return and sustained growth in air travel despite the fourth pandemic wave.
